reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on the 3 floors of a C19th commercial building on the corner of two major streets close to the centre of Turin, this small hotel is a very convenient base from which to explore the city. Trams, metro and buses are at the door, the main station is 10mins walk and the main sites 15 mins away by foot.
reviews.title: Small Period Hotel close to the centre of Turin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is accessed via a small cage elevator which is traditional in buildings of this vintage and beats lugging bags up 3 flights of stairs, although within the hotel itself access between floors is via a more modern small lift.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: The hotel has a beautiful small lounge with period funiture, elaborate frescoed ceiling and french windows onto the street and a small bar in the corner. Our room facing into a courtyard was on the 3rd floor and consisted of a smal siting room and adjacent bedroom, rather grandiosely described as a junior suite. It was small but perfectly adequate for one or two nights, clean but a little faded. The bathroom was narrow and one had to squeeze past the WC and bidet to get to the shower, not a problem but really only suitable for one person at a time.
reviews.title: A mixed bag at the Biancamano

likes.disliked: — the tired decor and tiny bed
